description:
The Feed & News Reader for webOS!
Enjoy reading news, or feeds with style.

Headlines2 is completely rewritten from scratch and strictly designed for the Touchpad.

** If you experience any issues or have suggestions for new features/improving the app, please contact us directly at support@codingbees.com since we can't respond to reviews here in the AppCatalog **

Features:
- Landscape & portrait mode
- RSS feed and Google News support
- Custom News search topics
- Specify a language for each topic
- Read-state saving for feeds for at least 30 days
- Background update (if configured)
- Offline support for articles
- Pull to refresh article list
- Advanced Sharing options:
   - Read Later support: Instapaper & Read it Later
   - Bookmark Service support: Delicious, Diigo, Pinboard & Zootool
   - Tweet about an interesting article right directly from the app!
   - Advanced Browser support
   - neato!
   - and much more
- completely configurable from the settings
- Read articles in an optimized version with readability
- Rich options for changing the way of reading an article
   - different fonts and sizes
   - width of article view and line spacing adjustable
   - change brightness from within the app (best if reading in the night)
- Pull to read next/previous article
- Choose between RSS, Readability, Instapaper Mobilizer or Webview to read the current article
- Touch-to-Share support when in article view

Please note:
Headlines2 is NOT a Google Reader client and maybe never will be. That depends mainly on the future of webOS.

Currently available in English, French & German.

Whats new:
Please have a look at http://codingbees.com for a complete overview since we only can provide 2000 characters here.
versionNote:
[FIX] App should now work as expected when deleted and re-installed
[CHG] GetPocket.com added (formerly known as Read It Later). If you used the service before you don’t need to do anything
[FIX] The way articles are stored in the database has changed. Read articles are now deleted more often
[ADD] Unread articles that are older than 30 days are now being deleted automatically
[FIX] Articles older than 30 days are ignored when fetched from the feed, this changes the behavior of low-traffic feeds
[ADD] Ability to mark (favorite) an article, this way an article will not be deleted automatically
